sen.j: 吉田神社（よしだじんじゃ）は、京都市左京区吉田神楽岡町の吉田山にある神社。
sen.e: Yoshida Shrine is a shrine on Mt. Yoshida, in Kaguraoka-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto.
Yoshida-jinja Shrine is a shrine on Mt. Yoshida, in Kaguraoka-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.
Yoshida-jinja Shrine is a shrine on Mt. Yoshida, in Kaguraoka-cho, Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City.

sen.j: 祭神
春日神であるタケミカヅチ（たけみかづちのみこと）、経津主神（いわいぬしのみこと）、天児屋命（あまのこやねのみこと）、比売神（ひめのかみ）を祀る。
sen.e: Takemikazuchi-no-mikoto (Kasuga-no-kami), Futsunushi-no-kami (Iwainushi-no-mikoto), Ame-no-koyane-no-mikoto, and Hime-no-kami are enshrined.
Takemikazuchi-no-mikoto (Kasuga-no-kami), Futsunushi-no-kami (Iwainushi-no-mikoto), Ama-no-koyane-no-mikoto, and Hime-no-kami are enshrined.
sen.cmt: 原文には、天児屋命 (あまのこやねのみこと）とあるが、英訳があめのこやねのみこと(Ame-no-Koyane-no-mikoto) になっている。調べたところ、両方の読み方あり。原文に合わせると、左記のようになる。
sen.e: Takemikazuchi-no-mikoto (Kasuga-no-kami), Futsunushi-no-kami (Iwainushi-no-mikoto), Ama-no-koyane-no-mikoto, and Hime-no-kami are enshrined.

sen.j: 由緒
貞観 (日本)元年（859年）、藤原山蔭が一門の氏神として奈良市の春日大社四座の神を勧請したのに始まる。
sen.e: It began in the 1st year of Jogan (859 AD), when FUJIWARA no Yamakage brought the four deities from Kasuga Shrine in Nara City to be the tutelary deities of the family.
It began in the 1st year of Jogan (859 AD), when FUJIWARA no Yamakage brought the four deities from Kasuga Taisha Shrine in Nara City to be the tutelary deities of the family.
It began in 859, when FUJIWARA no Yamakage brought the four deities from Kasuga Taisha Shrine in Nara City to be the tutelary deities of the family.

sen.j: 後に、平安京における藤原氏全体の氏神として崇敬を受けるようになった。
sen.e: They later came to be revered as tutelary deities of the whole Fujiwara clan of Heian-Kyo.
They later came to be revered as tutelary deities of the whole Fujiwara clan of Heian-Kyo.
They later came to be revered as tutelary deities of the whole Fujiwara clan of Heian-Kyo.

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳への記載はない（式外社）が、永延元年（987年）より朝廷の公祭に預かるようになり、正暦2年（991年）には二十二社の前身である十九社奉幣に加列された。
sen.e: Although it is not listed in the Engi-shiki Jimmyo-cho (it is a Shikigesha), it was in charge of official functions of the imperial court starting in Eien 1 (987 AD), and in Shoryaku 2 (991) was included in the 19 Shrines offering, which was a predecessor to the 22 shrines.

Although it is not listed in the Engi-shiki Jimmyo-cho (it is a Shikigesha), it was in charge of official functions of the Imperial Court starting in Eien 1 (987 AD), and in Shoryaku 2 (991) was included in the 19 Shrines offering, which was a predecessor to the 22 shrines.
sen.cmt: imperial court→Imperial Court 辞書で大文字にされている。
sen.e: Although it is not listed in the Engi-shiki Jimmyo-cho (it is a Shikigesha), it was in charge of official functions of the Imperial Court starting in 987, and in 991was included in the 19 Shrines offering, which was a predecessor to the 22 shrines.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代以降は、卜部氏（後の吉田氏）が神職を相伝するようになった。
sen.e: Since the Kamakura period, the Urabe clan (later the Yoshida clan) became the hereditary priests.
Since the Kamakura period, the Urabe clan (later the Yoshida clan) became the hereditary priests.
Since the Kamakura period, the Urabe clan (later the Yoshida clan) became the hereditary priests.

sen.j: 室町時代末期の文明 (日本)年間（1469年 - 1487年）には吉田兼倶が吉田神道（唯一神道）を創始し、その拠点として1484年、境内に末社・斎場所大元宮を建立した。
sen.e: During the Bummei years (1469-1487) at the end of the Muromachi period, Kanetomo YOSHIDA founded Yoshida Shinto (Yuiitsu Shinto), building the sub-shrine Saijosho Daidengu on the grounds as its focal point in 1484.

During the Bummei years (1469-1487) at the end of the Muromachi period, Kanetomo YOSHIDA founded Yoshida Shinto (Yuiitsu Shinto), building Massha Shrine Saijosho Daigengu on the grounds as its focal point in 1484.
sen.cmt: Saijosho Daidengu→Saijosho Daigengu the sub-shrine→Massha : Masshaは本社に付属する社で、本社と摂社の下に位する。sub-shrineという意味であっているが、摂社も同じくsyb-shrine なので、違いを付ける為Massha と表記した。
sen.e: During the Bummei years (1469-1487) at the end of the Muromachi period, Kanetomo YOSHIDA founded Yoshida Shinto (Yuiitsu Shinto), building Massha Shrine Saijosho Daigengu on the grounds as its focal point in 1484.

sen.j: 近世始めには吉田兼見が、かつて律令制時代の神祇官に祀られていた八神殿（現在はない）を境内の斎場に移し、これを神祇官代とした。
sen.e: Around that time Kanemi YOSHIDA moved Hasshinden (no longer present), which was in the Jingikan from the days of the old Ritsuryo system, to the funeral hall on the grounds, and used it as a replacement for the Jingikan.

Around that time Kanemi YOSHIDA moved Hasshinden (no longer present), which was in the Jingikan from the days of the old Ritsuryo system, to the funeral hall on the grounds, and used it as a replacement for the Jingikan.

Around that time Kanemi YOSHIDA moved Hasshinden (no longer present), which was in the Jingikan from the days of the old Ritsuryo system, to the funeral hall on the grounds, and used it as a replacement for the Jingikan.

sen.j: 吉田家は全国の神社の神職の任免権などを持ち、明治になるまで神道界に大きな権威を持っていた。
sen.e: The Yoshida household had authority to appoint priests to shrines nationally, and had great influence in Shinto circles until Meiji.
The Yoshida household had authority to appoint priests to shrines nationally, and had great influence in Shinto circles until the Meiji period.
The Yoshida household had authority to appoint priests to shrines nationally, and had great influence in Shinto circles until the Meiji period.

sen.j: 祭事
2月2-4日の節分が有名。
sen.cmt: 節分の説明を補足すれば、"Setsubun" is a traditional Japanese event.

sen.j: 施設
摂社
若宮社（祭神：天忍雲根命）
春日大社にも天忍雲根命を祀った若宮神社がある。
sen.e: Wakamiya Shrine, in Kasuga Taisha, also enshrines Ame-no-Oshikumone-no-mikoto.
Wakamiya-jinja Shrine, in Kasuga-taisha Shrine also enshrines Ame-no-Oshikumone-no-mikoto.
sen.cmt: Wakamiya Shrine→Wakamiya-jinja Shrine Kasuga Taisha→Kasuga-taisha Shrine
sen.e: Wakamiya Shrine, in Kasuga-taisha Shrine also enshrines Ame-no-Oshikumone-no-mikoto.

sen.j: 神楽岡社（祭神：雷神、オオヤマツミ、淤加美神（2文字目は「雨」の下に「口口口」、その下に「龍」）
地域の地主神で、延喜式神名帳に記載のある霹靂神だと言われている。
sen.e: The local landlord deity, Hatata-gami, is thought to be listed in the Engi-shiki Jimmyo-cho.
The local landlord deity, Hatata-gami, is thought to be listed in the Engi-shiki Jimmyo-cho.
The local landlord deity, Hatata-gami, is thought to be listed in the Engi-shiki Jimmyo-cho.

sen.j: 例祭は9月23日で神幸祭が10月最終日曜に行なわれる。
sen.e: The Rei-sai festival is September 23rd; and Shinko-sai is held on the last Sunday in October.
The Rei-sai festival is September 23rd; and Shinko-sai is held on the last Sunday in October.
The Rei-sai festival is September 23rd; and Shinko-sai is held on the last Sunday in October.

sen.j: 末社
sen.cmt: Masshaは本社に付属する社で、本社と摂社の下に位する。sub-shrineという意味であっているが、摂社も同じくsyb-shrine なので、違いを付ける為Massha と表記した。

sen.j: 斎場所大元宮（さいじょうしょだいげんぐう、祭神：天神地祇八百万神）
延喜式内社全3132座の天神地祇八百万神を祀る。
sen.e: It enshrines all 3,132 of the Amatsukami-kunitsukami-yaoyorozu-no-kamis in Engi Shikinaisha.
It enshrines all 3132 deities of the Engi Shikinai-sha Shrines, which are called the Amatsukami-kunitsukami-yaoyorozu-no-kami.
sen.cmt: Engi Shikinaisha→Engi Shikinai-sha Shrines 注 : Engi Shikinai-sha Shrines→Shrines that are listed in the Engi-shiki the Amatsukami-kunitsukami-yaoyorozu-no-kamis→the Amatsukami-kunitsukami-yaoyorozu-no-kami 八百万神という言葉そのものが複数形なので、kamisとする必要無しと判断し修正。また原文に合うように文章を修正。
sen.e: It enshrines all 3132 deities of the Engi Shikinai-sha Shrines, which are called the Amatsukami-kunitsukami-yaoyorozu-no-kami.

sen.j: 八角形の本殿に六角の後房を付けた、極めて特異な形状をしており、重要文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: Designated an Important Cultural Artifact, it has an exceedingly odd shape, with its octagonal great hall and hexagonal vestibule.
Designated an Important Cultural Asset, it has an exceedingly unique shape, with its octagonal main hall and hexagonal back room.
sen.cmt: 重要文化財→Important Cultural Asset odd→unique 本文に特異な、とある。oddだとむしろ奇妙な、ではないかと思い修正。 本殿をgreat hall→main hall 後房をvestible→back roomと修正。
sen.e: Designated an Important Cultural Asset, it has an exceedingly unique shape, with its octagonal main hall and hexagonal back room.

sen.j: 神龍社（祭神：吉田兼倶（神龍大神））
sen.cmt: Kamitatsu Shrine→Kamitatsu-sha Shrine Kamitatsu Omikami→Kamitatsu Okami : termsに記載がある方に変更。調べたところ、大神自体はどちらの読み方もあり。この社に関してどちらが正しいかの確認出来ず。

sen.j: 永正10年（1513年）に創建。
例祭日は2月19日。
sen.e: The Rei-sai festival is on February 19.
sen.cmt: Rei-sai→The Rei-sai festival 上記に倣って修正。文章もis を補足。
sen.e: The Rei-sai festival is on February 19.

sen.j: 今宮社（祭神：大国主・雷神・スサノオ）
社殿内と境内に、四神を配した石がある。
sen.e: In the hall and on the grounds, there are stones for the four gods.
In the hall and on the grounds, there are stones for the four gods.
In the hall and on the grounds, there are stones for the four gods.

sen.j: 祖霊社（祭神：講員の祖霊）
菓祖神社（祭神：タヂマモリ、林浄因）
菓子の神（菓祖）として製菓業者の信仰を集める。
sen.e: Worshiped by candy merchants as the god of candy (Kaso).
Worshiped by candy merchants as the god of candy (Kaso).
Worshiped by candy merchants as the god of candy (Kaso).

sen.j: 山蔭神社（祭神：藤原山蔭、相殿：えびす）
sen.e: Yamakage Shrine (Deities: FUJIWARA no Yamakage, together with Ebisu)
Yamakage-jinja Shrine (Deities: FUJIWARA no Yamakage, together with Ebisu)
Yamakage-jinja Shrine (Deities: FUJIWARA no Yamakage, together with Ebisu).

sen.j: 藤原山蔭は吉田神社の創始者で、料理人。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Yamakage was the founder of Yoshida Jinja, and a chef.
FUJIWARA no Yamakage was the founder of Yoshida-jinja Shrine, and a chef.
FUJIWARA no Yamakage was the founder of Yoshida-jinja Shrine, and a chef.

sen.j: 自身も料理の神として信仰を受けている。
sen.e: He has been worshiped as a god of cooking.
He has been worshiped as a god of cooking.
He has been worshiped as a god of cooking.

sen.j: 三社社（祭神：宗像三女神、金山彦神、菅原道真）
sen.e: Sanja-sha (Deities: Munakata-sanjojin, Kanayamahiko-no-kami, SUGAWARA no Michizane)
Sanja-sha Shrine (Deities: Munakata-sanjojin, Kanayamahiko-no-kami, SUGAWARA no Michizane)
Sanja-sha Shrine (Deities: Munakata-sanjojin, Kanayamahiko-no-kami, SUGAWARA no Michizane)

sen.j: 竹中稲荷神社（祭神：ウカノミタマ、サルタヒコ、アメノウズメ）
もとは独立した神社。
吉田神社の末社となった。
sen.e: It became a sub-shrine of Yoshida Shrine.
It became a Massha shrine of Yoshida-jinja Shrine.
It became a Massha shrine of Yoshida-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 摂末社：稲荷社、稲荷塚計50基（社）以上
摂末社：天満宮社（祭神：菅原道真）
sen.e: Setsumatsu-sha Shrine: Tenmangu-sha Shrine (Deity: SUGAWARA no Michizane)
Setsumatsu-sha Shrine: Tenmangu-sha Shrine (Deity: SUGAWARA no Michizane)

sen.j: ほか多数ある
その他の施設
吉田幼稚園
文化財
sen.cmt: 文化財は、Cultural Assets とされる方が一般的。

sen.j: 建築物
重要文化財「吉田神社 斎場所大元宮」
sen.e: Important Cultural Artifact: Yoshida Shrine - Saijosho Daigengu
Important Cultural Assets: Yoshida-jinja Shrine Saijosho Daigengu
sen.cmt: 文化財は、Cultural Assets とされる方が一般的。 Yoshida Shrine→Yoshida-jinja Shrine
sen.e: Important Cultural Assets: Yoshida-jinja Shrine Saijosho Daigengu

sen.j: 建造：推定1601年
その他
京都大学吉田キャンパスに隣接している。
sen.e: Adjacent to Kyoto University Yoshida Campus
Adjacent to Kyoto University Yoshida Campus
Adjacent to Kyoto University Yoshida Campus

sen.j: 京大志望の受験生が吉田神社に合格祈願に行くと必ず落ちるという都市伝説が定着している。
sen.e: An urban legend has it that students who go to Yoshida Shrine to pray that will pass the Kyoto University entrance exams will always fail.
An urban legend has it that students who go to Yoshida-jinja Shrine to pray for passing the Kyoto University entrance exams will always fail.
sen.cmt: Yoshida Shrine→Yoshida-jinja Shrine that will pass→for passing : willが二度続かないように修正。
sen.e: An urban legend has it that students who go to Yoshida-jinja Shrine to pray for passing the Kyoto University entrance exams will always fail.

sen.j: 交通
最寄駅：京阪出町柳駅
駐車場：有り
